ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: learn about the specifics of the hedge fund industry, particularly about arbitrage trades.
The class gave a greater understanding of the strategies used by hedge funds, as well as the role hedge funds play in the overall market.
Economics knowledge, mathematical skills, reading comprehension, critical thinking

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strength: awesome professor cool material weaknesses: the class got too focused on specific aspects of hedge fund trading rather than addressing the bigger picture and the overall industry.

I think the class was a great balance of quantitative work and qualitative understanding of the underlying principles. I think a weakness was shown in the final project. Selecting an individual investment was not a topic covered in the course. It was very unclear what were the correct aspects of the possible long/short to consider.
This course is so awesome!!! Covers really interesting material at a very manageable pace. No weaknesses!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: if you are certain you want to work in finance and particularly at a hedge fund.
100% recommend!!!! This course was amazing, super interesting and fairly easy to keep up with. It was ingaging, and the best course I've taken at yale. TAKE THIS CLASS!!!! Absolutely no weaknesses
